root.name: Final Fight Revenge
root.description: OverviewRevenge is a 3D fighting game that was released in the arcades in 1999 made on the Sega ST-V hardware. A home version was later released on the Sega Saturn in Japan on March 30, 2000. This Spin-off of the Final Fight franchise was Developed by the same American Team responsible for such gems as Maximo and Final Fight: Streetwise. Game PlayFinal Fight Revenge featured a control figuration of an eight directional Joystick and five buttons, (two punches, two kicks and one Special). Final Fight Revenge was a critical and financial failure. The game never saw light outside of a few Japanese arcades and a Japanese Saturn port, despite featuring full English localization. StoryFinal Fight Revenge takes place in-between the Original Final Fight and Street fighter Alpha 3, The Mad Gear gang is looking to Rebuild and reestablish themselves as a force to be reckon with in Metro City. Playing through the Single player Campaign you fight through 6 other opponents and a Final Boss which is a Zombified version of Belger from the First Final Fight game. He is not a playable character. Sega Saturn PortThe Saturn version of the game required the 4-meg RAM cartridge to play. Characters Cody Travers Guy Mike Hagger Andore Poison Edi E. Damnd El Gado Rolento Sodom Horace Belger (Zombie, Boss)
